quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hey Jim, Jim. Come here. [holds up photo] Do you know who that is?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Look at him. Look at him - t-shirt, jeans...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Is he you?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [laughs] I am flattered. That's Johnny Depp.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Where did you take that?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: In my condo complex.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh my God, that's right. I read in People magazine that he was looking for a two-bedroom condo in Scranton.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I am flipping out, man. I mean, you remember my idea for the fourth Pirates movie.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Sure. That they should do one.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [feigning accent] Hey, Jim, Jim - where, where do I find the Black Pearl?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Who's that?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Captain Jack Sparrow. Captain Jack Sparrow, Jim.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: John Dillinger.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No. I'm Captain Jack Sparrow.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Captain Crunch.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Okay, okay. Screw you, Halpert. You know, it's not easy getting excited about stuff. Remember how you felt when you thought you'd seen Roger Clemens?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: At the Yankees game. Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yeah. Well, it wasn't him.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I had a little better reason to believe that... You're right. You're right. Well, you're not right, because Johnny Depp...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I know, I know.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: ...in your condo complex.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I know! It also explains why the name on his mailbox was M Shulman.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: M. Night Shulman?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [speaking at a staff meeting] First up, the lost and found has gone missing. It itself is lost, so please, try not to lose anything until we find it. Ah, pet day. If you don't have a pet, please don't feel like -

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: When are we getting to sales topics?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Yeah, what about those leads? Did you hear anything from corporate?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Ah, yes, the leads. The leads that Sabre has spent $50,000 to get from a market research company... are not here yet. But will be.. [muttering, people rise to leave] No, no, meeting's not over.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: But is there anything relevant to the sales staff here?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No sales topic per se.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Well then no Andy Bernard per se. [Andy and others begin exiting the room]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Dwight?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Sorry, Michael, I got calls to make.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I would like your undivided attention, please.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: You couldn't handle my undivided attention.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Over the last few weeks, things have been changing here. Sabre says it is our duty to support the sales team and the salesmen are letting it go to their heads. I think it's kind of screwed up, because the way this place used to work was: make friends first, make sales second, make love third, in no particular order.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Listen, Michael - about what happened earlier.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: When I was asking about the leads.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: M-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: ... is there any news on the leads?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Is that all you have to say to me?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Yeah. You got any news on the leads? ... Okay, I'll tell you what. I'm going out on a very important sales call. You get any news about the leads, you try me. All of my numbers. All six of my numbers, okay? Including the car phone! [leaves office] Alright, Dwight out!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Salesman is king. As the best salesman, I am king of kings. Oh, you say Jesus is king of kings? Well. What does that say to you about how I think of myself?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Hm-hm. Do you not answer e-mails anymore? Because I've e-mailed you four times asking you to come to my desk.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Honey, if I don't have time to answer an e-mail, I definitely don't have time to walk over to your desk.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Wow, wowie wowie. Congratulations. It's a big cheque. [Jim stands in corner, texting]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh, sorry, wait one second.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Stop sexting Pam. I'm trying to congratulate you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: This is actually a big potential sale, so...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You writing your memoirs over there?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: You writing your name over there?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Well, it's a pretty big check.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: That's good. You know, with the kid.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Okay. Don't gloat. Here's the thing. This kind of money can corrupt people.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Alright, here we go. [taps page] Michael...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I'm just saying, that -

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Michael - [Michael signs] Great.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: [on phone] Very nice. Let me just, let me just write that down real quick. [motions to Darryl] Pencil? Can you give me that pencil? Hang on Teddy... [covers phone] I'm making a sale. Sales.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: There's other pencil's in this office.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Give me that [wrestles with Darryl, Andy falls over chair and to the floor]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Honey and jelly sandwich time. [removes lunch from fridge]

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh, you got to be kidding me. [holds up squashed sandwich] Look at that. That's -

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: I know who did that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You saw who did this and you didn't stop them?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Didn't have to see. It was sales. I can feel it. They are out of control.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: The sales department smashed my sandwich.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Yes. All of 'em. Together. It's a conspiracy. Listen to me, Mike, you gotta do something about them.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You don't get it.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: You need to get back on top.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: That's what she said.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Something came for you, Michael. [hands him a parcel]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Thank you very much.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: What'd you get?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Ah, just the stupid leads.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Alright!

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: About time.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Me likey!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Finally, Michael. Hand 'em over, numbnuts. [Michael stares at her incredulously] But seriously. It's your job to give us those leads.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Alright. Then I guess I should give them out. Hold on. You know what I'm thinking? I'm thinking that I have something that you want. You guys are acting like you own this place. And you don't. Not even Sabre owns this place. It's a rental. I'm kind of sick of the attitude around here. I'm sick of the cocky walk, I am sick of you throwing your paycheck in my face, I am sick of your uppity attitude, Jim... I think I am not going to give these to you. [Angela, Kevin and Oscar applaud]

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: We need those leads, Michael. It's our job Michael. Michael!

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.line: [on phone] Michael, we spent a lot of money on those leads. You have to give them out.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Then we are just rewarding their bad behaviour. Okay. Just - imagine that instead of going to jail for murdering someone, you got an ice-cream cone. If that were the case, then in the summertime, everyone would go around killing people for the pleasure of an ice-cream cone.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.line: Michael, I don't want to incentivise murder. But - we've tried to make it clear that our policy emphasises sales staff -

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: They act like I have no power.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.line: But you do. You are in charge -

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.line: - of supporting the sales staff. You are required to hand out those leads, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hmm. Well, if that is what I am required to do, I will do exactly that.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.line: Okay, good.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Exactly that.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.line: Good.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Exactly that.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.line: Why do you keep repeating - [Michael hangs up]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hello. May I have everyone's attention, please? Gabe has instructed me to hand out the leads, so I'm going to give the leads to... King Creed! [hands him a lead]

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: What are you -

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: - and to King Meredith! [hands her a lead]

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: They aren't salespeople!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: And to King Angela! [hands her a lead] Because today we are all kings. And queens [pats Oscar's shoulder].

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: What the hell do you think you're doing?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I'm giving them the leads, Phyllis.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: So I'm going to go ahead and save you some time, and tell you that no-one's going to go along with this. But you knew that, right?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Mm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Alright. So why don't you just give me my share of the leads, and I'll start making some calls?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Okay. [passes Jim some index cards]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Hey, alright.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Alright.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Ahh, these aren't leads. What are they?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh, right, those are clues. And within each clue is a lesson. You learn a lesson, and then you find a lead. The leads are scattered all over the industrial park. I am trying to make your kids respect you. Because a father needs to respect his boss, and kids don't respect the father who doesn't respect the boss. Do you understand that line of logic?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I don't think you understand -

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: I do understand it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [holds up card] This one's a map.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Or is it?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Oh, how the tables have turned. I see you got my e-mail.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Are you gonna give me the leads or not?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: I'll give you the leads. But you know what? It's going to cost you some clerical work [hands her a mountain of paperwork]

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: What are these for?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: It doesn't matter. Fill them out. All of them. Then when you're done, you can watch me shred them.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: I want to watch the Kardashians! I don't want to watch boring -

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: It's my -

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: The Kardashians is a good show.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: No it's - how would he even know the Kardashians?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: It's about a family. A real-life family.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.line: No, Stanley, do you -

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [over phone] Hey baby, what's up?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I am currently reading incoherent riddles on blue index cards to find vital information that Michael has hidden all over the office. How are you?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Nothing but vomit and diapers over here.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh my god, I couldn't envy you more.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Having a baby is as exhausting as they say it is. Having two babies [holds up index cards] - that's just unfair.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: How about this one - 'When arrogant salesmen are mean to my face, a certain manager will go to his moppy place.'

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: He means his mopey place, it's under that streetlamp that he thinks was in Casablanca.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I love you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Today I turned an office crisis into a teachable moment. [cuts to Jim fishing one of the leads out of a catering size tin of Ravioli] A lesser manager would have screwed this day up royally [clue next to Jim reads: 'Now that's Italian!'] Some yokel sitting behind his desk saying take a lead, learn nothing [cut to scenes of chaos as everyone argues] Some people shouldn't be in this business.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Hey. I guess you probably won't give me your leads since I'm a jerk salesman.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Yeah. I basically wish you were dead. [grins] I hid the leads.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Where?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: [mimes zipping mouth and throwing away key, Andy begins to walk away] Colder. Colder. Warmer. Warmer. Colder. Colder. Warmer. Warmer. Warmer. Hot. [Andy hovers his hands above her chest] Hotter. Pretty hot. Lower.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Are you...

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Lower.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Are you sure?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Lower [tilts head toward her desk, then flips over her keyboard, revealing the leads. Andy scratches his head, recovering]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: What are you doing, idiot? [Jim is crouched down, peering under a car]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Michael's stupid scavenger hunt.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Scavenger hunt? Here. I can solve it. Give it. [grabs card] 'The treasure you seek is in the parking lot under the first president.'

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [taps car] Lincoln.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: The prankster is getting pranked. Ha ha.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [holds up the retrieved lead] It involves you too.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: The leads are in?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Michael? Michael, you were supposed to tell me when the leads came in.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Well, bigshot, 'If you want to find your leads, go to the man who never breathes'.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Kevin! Damnit [runs over to Kevin's desk] Kevin, give me those leads. Where are they? C'mon -

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: You are never going to find them.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Really.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: I'm going to enjoy this.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [begins to strangle him] Gimme the leads. Where are my leads?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: [muffled] I'm still enjoying  it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Where are they?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Turn the trash. Turn the trash.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Turn the trash [releases him - Kevin coughs] It's code. Alright, Meredith, take off your dress.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: [stands up and reaches for her buttons] Okey-dokey.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: No, dear god, no, it's in the trash can. In the kitchen.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: It's coming off anyway.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [dashes to kitchen, overturns the trash can, tastes the bin liner] Clean sack.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: What -

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: I emptied it in the dumpster. With Toby's baba ganoush.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: If we don't patronise the only Syrian restaurant in town, there'll be nothing left but pan pizzas and make-your-own salads.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [dives into dumpster, rattling noises then he emerges] It's empty!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Wait. What day is today?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Um, tonight is Ghost Whisperer. So, Friday.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Oh my god. Oh my god [takes off running] oh my god, no, no no, hey, hey [chases after garbage van] wait, wait!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Okay. You know what, let's just go to the dump, start looking - Ryan, c'mon, shotgun in my car -

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Michael, why would we all go to the dump?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Why? Because I am not going to call Sabre and say, 'Hi, you know those very valuable expensive leads that you gave us earlier today? Well, because of a screw-up by a staff member, they're now in the city dump."

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Not your staff, Michael. You.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Well, that's not the way it's going t sound. Here's what we're going to do. We'll go to the dump, we'll look around, then we'll all go out and get pizza, maybe catch a movie, late-night drink, some more pizza, call it a night. What do you -

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Does it have to be pizza? Could go for a, falafel?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Really?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: I'm not going. You did this, not us.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Okay, no, you encouraged it. You were complicit [looks to Jim for vocab-reassurance] Complicit. You were all successories!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: That sounds fun, mucking around in the dump. Wish I could go.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You can.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: I can't. You know that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Okay fine, I get it. I'll just go by myself.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I'll go, Michael. You'll just screw it up.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [looks around dump] This place has gone to hell.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You know, Dwight, there was a time when you'd be pinching yourself to have the opportunity to look through a dump with me.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Yeah, well, the acorn becomes the oak.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yeah. Sometimes the acorn just stays the acorn. If you don't believe me, look in my gutters.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: [to Oscar] You're adorable. You need to go for it. [Jim enters the break room] I'm going to be, like, mad at you if you don't -

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Phew! Can't wait for this day to be over.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Why?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Just all the - drama.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: What drama?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Between the - us and you guys. It's unnecessary, right?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: So unnecessary.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh, good, phew,  thank god you said that.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: I mean, if the salesmen weren't acting like such a bunch of stuck-up losers, then this day wouldn't be so bad - did you ever think of that?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I have new baby pictures.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.line: Don't use your cute baby to make us like you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: She's wearing a onesie [holds out his cell phone, Oscar leans in but Kelly grabs his arm]

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: If we act nice now, then we're rewarding them for treating us poorly.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Didn't we kind of start it?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: I think you're remembering that wrong?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: I don't know about this. I mean, I think we should hold our ground. The company's changed, and if they don't like it, they can leave. I mean, a lot of their work can be done from India.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Can we at least all agree that this is uncomfortable, and may be heading for something bad?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: All those who agree, say aye [all present - Stanley, Andy and Phyllis -  raise their hands] All those opposed -

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I don't think we need opposed.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: [kicking through rubbish at the dump] You've changed, man.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Oh, why, because I have a shot at a $100k commission?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Since when do you care about money? When I first met you, you were a wide-eyed innocent.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Hey. There is nothing I can do about my wide-set eyes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No, I'm talking about your personality, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: When I first met you, I had a lot of job offers. And I had an offer from Ivan Schartsky. The Ivan Schartsky. And if I'd assistant managed him -

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Assistant to the managed him -

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Oh, that's low! I would be number two right now at Home Depot!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Okay? Because they promote from within. Instead I had to follow you - you, going nowhere.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You think you would have done better without me? Really?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I hitched my wagon to a horse with no legs.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Wow. Ohhhkay. Man. When I think about all the time I wasted being your friend - I shouldn't have been hanging out watching karate movies with you -

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Kung-fu movies!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: You know what, I should have been doing? I should have been out at bars, finding my soul-mate, finding my wife, making babies -

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Nice babies you're making with the floozies at the bars.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: That's my wife you're talking about, man.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Your made-up wife? Who doesn't exist? [Michael picks up a piece of metal and hurls it at Dwight, who sidesteps] You watch it!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: If I wanted to hit you, I would have hit you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Don't do it [lobs something at Michael]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No no. You just made an enemy with the wrong guy, Dwight. [they throw volleys of rubbish at each other] No, time out, time out. [Michael inspects a box, then hurls it at Dwight] Time in!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: No! [lunges for a large wooden spool]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Don't even think about that [Dwight begins rolling it towards Michael, as he reaches him Dwight kicks it and falls backward. The spool comes to a halt in front of Michael, and Michael pushes it towards Dwight.]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [kicks spool] Stop it, get out! That's my spool.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: What's the least we can do to make this okay?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I'll text Pam. She's really good at this stuff.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: And I'll text Erin. She's really good at this stuff too.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: I guess we could give them some of our new commissions.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: That is a dangerous precedent.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Pam texted back saying we could give them all iPods.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Oh, if they don't have an iPod by now they really don't want one.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Alright. Then we're back to cash. And I got to say, if giving a small percentage of our commissions is going to smooth all this over, I'm for it.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Okay, fine. Cash it is.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Erin just texted me back. 'People love shells from far-away beaches".

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Okay, Dwight. Here we go [picks up a sink, spills dump juice on his pants] oh god.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Oh [half-heartedly throws something]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: We're never going to find those leads, are we? [they both sit on the edge of a claw-footed bathtub]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [surveys the mountains of trash surrounding them] Wow. Amazing, isn't it. No other animal on earth could do this. Maybe beavers. But not like this.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: So how about, guys, one percent commission a month instead of two, what do you -

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: No, we agreed, two percent for the quarter. Okay [others enter] Hey everybody!

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: [stares at the table filled with treats] Nice spread. We get it. You eat like royalty.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: No, no - this is a representation of how we feel. And how we feel is: really sorry.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Yeah. We wanted to bring you in and make a peace offering.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Yeah, we wanted to do the right thing. So...  [Jim gestures for her to continue]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Way to go, guys. This was an integrity move.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Yeah. When we walked in here, we were all prepared to tell you to go to hell.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Do you have any pastries without fruit?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Yes! We do. [opens box] Eclairs.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: [enters room] Well, you better be happy, taking two percent of our -

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: - two percent milk! What I forgot for the coffee.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Our treats, Stanley, they've accepted our simple offer of treats. Nothing more.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: [beams] This is - nice! [pats Oscar's shoulder] All of us back together.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: This [picks up racquet] Why would somebody throw that out?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Hey [holds up an old sweater] You know who'd like this? Phyllis. Purple, much?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Yeah, she does - she loves purple. [Dwight sniffs it] Does it stink?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Yeah [puts it back in the bath tub]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: Know what would be a great picture here? Just this whole dump, and in the middle, one flower. That's it. And the caption would read:

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Hope - grows.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: In the dump.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [drives into office parking lot, honking horn. Enormous purple object strapped to the roof of their car] Woo hoo!

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Good news that you found our leads?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.line: No! Better!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: We have an awesome bean bag chair that's perfect for the break room. [reaches out the window and pats it]

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Yuck. I'm not going to sit on that disgusting seat.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Yeah, damn right you're not. 'Cause it's for me and Michael only [they both cheer and high-five]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: [at dump] It's freezing out here.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: [strips off jacket] Go on. I have warm blood. [tries to drape her small jacket across Andy's back]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Oh wow, thank you. You're the nicest person I've ever met. [Andy and Erin kiss]
